title: Do you think every combination of champion has been played?
body:
Hey guys and girls,

Fun simple question I have often pondered, and tonight I decided to dig a little deeper.

After the release of Bard there are now 124 champions in the game.
To pick 10 chmapions out of 124 = 124 choose 10 = 7 342 997 571 293 670 
And to sort them into two teams = 10 choose 5 = 252 
Multiply together and number of different games that would have needed to be played to have combination is 4.11*10^16 or, 
41 quadrillion 120 trillion 786 billion 339 million 244 thousand 552 GAMES!

Unlikely that many LOL game would ever be played. 
If someone could get me, half decent approximations of total; numbers of normal game, I would love to work what number of champions was likely to have every combination played and where it began to blow out. 

Hope you guys like Math :D
Skyprus
